On the other hand, in variant A , it is about a 7 day Time Travel period which cannot be kept, as it is not by default value. In addition, C is not right, because cloning transient table to permanent table cannot be cloned into permanent tables. I am not sure about the answer, I need to search more.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: A
https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/dynamic-tables-best-practices#label-best-practices-create-transient-dts
"Use transient dynamic tables to reduce storage cost
Transient dynamic tables maintain data reliably over time and support Time Travel within the data retention period, but don’t retain data beyond the fail-safe period. By default, dynamic table data is retained for 7 days in fail-safe storage. For dynamic tables with high refresh throughput, this can significantly increase storage consumption. Therefore, you should make a dynamic table transient only if its data doesn’t need the same level of data protection and recovery provided by permanent tables." I would say A

Selected Answer: A
Dimension tables often store relatively small amounts of data but can change frequently due to updates, inserts, or deletes. Managing costs efficiently involves minimizing storage costs associated with Time Travel and Fail-safe while maintaining the necessary data history for recovery purposes.

choices.D: Make the dimension tables permanent with a retention period of 7 days. Replicate the database to a secondary database once a week.
choices.C: Make the dimension tables transient and back-up the data daily into a permanent table using cloning.
choices.B: Make the dimension tables transient with a retention period of 0 days, and backup the table daily to a permanent table. Delete all but the latest backup.
choices.A: Keep the Time Travel retention period for the dimension tables to 7 days or less.

Which of the following are best practices for loading data into Snowflake? (Choose three.)

discussion.content: The answer is wrong it shorud be ACD ,Nobody can pass using these dumps They all have wrong Answers

comments.content: Bhai dil ki baat bol di..saare ke saare answers galat hai..admin bhai please revisit kar lo ek baar.

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: ACD
A, C, D

https://docs.snowflake.com/en/user-guide/data-load-considerations.html

A. To optimize the number of parallel operations for a load, we recommend aiming to produce data files roughly 100-250 MB (or larger) in size compressed.

C. Fields that contain delimiter characters should be enclosed in quotes (single or double). If the data contains single or double quotes, then those quotes must be escaped.

D. Split larger files into a greater number of smaller files to distribute the load among the compute resources in an active warehouse.
correct answer:ACD

Selected Answer: ACD
A. Aim to produce data files that are between 100 MB and 250 MB in size, compressed.
C. Enclose fields that contain delimiter characters in single or double quotes.
D. Split large files into a greater number of smaller files to distribute the load among the compute resources in an active warehouse.
Correct Answer: ACD

choices.C: Enclose fields that contain delimiter characters in single or double quotes.
choices.D: Split large files into a greater number of smaller files to distribute the load among the compute resources in an active warehouse.
choices.E: When planning which warehouse(s) to use for data loading, start with the largest warehouse possible.
choices.F: Partition the staged data into large folders with random paths, allowing Snowflake to determine the best way to load each file.
choices.B: Load data from files in a cloud storage service in a different region or cloud platform from the service or region containing the Snowflake account, to save on cost.
choices.A: Aim to produce data files that are between 100 MB and 250 MB in size, compressed.

Query acceleration can improve overall warehouse performance by reducing the impact of outlier queries (i.e. queries which use more resources then typical queries)
